main event: One object described as a three-cornered star, the size of a grapefruit, was sighted in Duncanville, Texas from 6:15 to 8:15 CST on December 12, 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed for two hours moving from East to West,The object changed color from white, green, and blue, and appeared to have points like antennas,The sighting was determined to be similar to Venus based on its trajectory and brightness,The observation was conducted using binoculars for clarity,There were no photographs taken as evidence, only an 8mm film submitted afterward.
witness description: Civilians who reported seeing the object through binoculars.
